body_html:
Hello, GaofengCheng

Did you solve this problem? If so, could you explain how you solve this?

My situation is exactly same as you. My company's firewall blocks my server from the Internet connection. So no Internet connection is available for my server. This caused tens of problems, but I solved all the error except this part. I'll restate my problem as follows. When I run
$ ./configure
, the following command fails.
$ bazel fetch //tensorflow/...

This bazel command is supposed to fetch all the packages in target tensorflow from the Internet. I also downloaded links manually with wget, but it seems something is wrong when I run the next command in the TensorFlow installation manual.

$ bazel build -c opt -config=cuda //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer

I'd appreciate your feedback.

body:
Hello, GaofengCheng

Did you solve this problem? If so, could you explain how you solve this?

My situation is exactly same as you. My company's firewall blocks my server from the Internet connection.  So no Internet connection is available for my server. This caused tens of problems, but I solved all the error except this part. I'll restate my problem as follows. When I run
  $ ./configure
, the following command fails.
   $ bazel fetch //tensorflow/...

This bazel command is supposed to fetch all the packages in target tensorflow from the Internet. I also downloaded links manually with wget, but it seems something is wrong when I run the next command in the TensorFlow installation manual.

$ bazel build -c opt -config=cuda //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer

I'd appreciate your feedback.
